questions.qBody: Johnny said, 'I don't want to go to school.'
questions.key: Johnny said that he didn't want to go to school.
questions.notes: 使用間接引述時須注意人稱的轉換；本例Johnny口中第一人稱的I，在引述者的立場成為第三人稱的he。其次也要注意時態的一致，配合主要子句的過去式動詞said，名詞子句的動詞部分由don't want to改成didn't want to。

questions.qBody: Ruby said, 'I have to ask for my father's permission.'
questions.key: Ruby said she had to ask for her father's permission.
questions.notes: 使用間接引述時須注意人稱的轉換；本例Ruby口中第一人稱的I，在引述者的立場成為第三人稱的she，而my father's也跟著變成her father's。其次也要注意時態的一致，配合主要子句的過去式動詞said，名詞子句的動詞部分由have to改成had to。

questions.qBody: Paul said, 'I submitted my application two days before the deadline.'
questions.key: Paul said he had submitted his application two days before the deadline.
questions.notes: 本例中submit發生的時間早於say，而兩者都發生在過去，因此在間接引述時為了表現出兩個動作的先後順序，分別使用過去完成式的had submitted和過去簡單式的said。在非正式用法中，兩者皆用過去簡單式亦可。

questions.qBody: 'We have never seen anything like this,' replied the children.
questions.key: The children replied that they had never seen anything like this.
questions.notes: 配合主要子句的過去式動詞replied，名詞子句中原本現在完成式的have never seen改成過去完成式had never seen。

questions.qBody: 'Ted and I are going to visit our grandparents,' she said to me.
questions.hint: She told me that she and Ted
questions.key: She told me that she and Ted were going to visit their grandparents.
questions.notes: 配合主要子句的過去式動詞told，名詞子句中的are going to visit改成were going to visit。

questions.qBody: I will go back to work only if the manager apologizes,' she explained.
questions.key: She explained that she would go back to work only if the manager apologized.
questions.notes: 配合主要子句的過去式動詞explained，名詞子句中的will go改成would go，條件句中的apologizes改成apologized。

questions.qBody: 'Both my parents are high school teachers', he said.
questions.key: He told me both his parents are high school teachers.
questions.notes: 在非正式用法中，名詞子句的動詞未必會配合主要子句而改變時態。尤其當名詞子句的內容在引述的當時仍為事實，如本例。

questions.qBody: 'Next week's exam will not be easy,' said the teacher.
questions.key: The teacher said that next week's exam will not be easy.
questions.notes: 本例中，老師不久前說的話被引述，然而考試下週才會舉行，因此名詞子句仍維持未來式will not be。在正式用法中則可能使用would not be。

questions.qBody: She said, 'Please leave your umbrellas in the stand at the entrance.'
questions.key: She asked us to leave our umbrellas in the stand at the entrance.
questions.notes: 當引述的內容為祈使句時，應使用不定詞。此時主要子句的動詞不用say而改用tell或ask。

questions.qBody: 'Do not make any unnecessary marks on the answer sheet,' said the teacher.
questions.key: The teacher told the students not to make any unnecessary marks on the answer sheet.
questions.notes: 當引述的內容為祈使句時，應使用不定詞。注意否定詞not的位置應該在不定詞之前。

questions.qBody: What goals are you pursuing? You should first ask yourself that question.
questions.key: You should first ask yourself what goals you are pursuing.
questions.notes: 疑問句被引述時就成為名詞子句，不再適用原來的句法，也就是說，原本形成疑問句的「倒裝」結構必須加以「還原」；本例的are在疑問句中經過「倒裝」而移至you之前，在名詞子句中就應該「還原」而回到you之後。

questions.qBody: What does the word mean? Does anybody know?
questions.key: Does anybody know what the word means?
questions.notes: 本例的What does the word mean一旦接在know後面作受詞，就成為名詞子句而不再適用疑問句法，因此不需要助動詞does；接在第三人稱單數主詞the word之後的動詞mean，也因為does消失而還原成means。

questions.qBody: Where can I get my blood pressure checked?
questions.key: Could you tell me where I can get my blood pressure checked?
questions.notes: can I get是經過倒裝的疑問句式，在名詞子句中要還原為I can get。

questions.qBody: What have we achieved in the past few months?
questions.key: Let's take a look at what we have achieved in the past few months.
questions.notes: have we achieved是經過倒裝的疑問句式，在名詞子句中要還原為we have achieved。

questions.qBody: Where would they like their wedding to take place?
questions.hint: Now that the date has been set, they have to decide on
questions.key: Now that the date has been set, they have to decide on where they would like their wedding to take place.
questions.notes: would they like是經過倒裝的疑問句式，在名詞子句中要還原為they would like。

questions.qBody: How many students were there in the auditorium?
questions.key: The speaker was amazed by how many students there were in the auditorium.
questions.notes: How many ... were there是經過倒裝的疑問句式，在名詞子句中要還原為there were。

questions.qBody: Is the committee going to issue a formal statement?
questions.key: It is still unclear whether the committee is going to issue a formal statement.
questions.notes: Is the committee going是經過倒裝的疑問句，在名詞子句中要還原為the committee is going；注意：原本的問句是不含疑問詞的Yes-No問句，轉成名詞子句時要加上連接詞whether。

questions.qBody: Was a third person involved in the incident? The police are still investigating.
questions.key: The police are still investigating whether a third person was involved in the incident.
questions.notes: 原本不含疑問詞的Yes-No問句轉成名詞子句時，要加上連接詞whether；was a third person involved是經過倒裝的疑問句式，在名詞子句中要還原為a third person was involved。

questions.qBody: Who left the air conditioner running all night?
questions.hint: The boss is eager to find out
questions.key: The boss is eager to find out who left the air conditioner running all night.
questions.notes: 原本問句的疑問詞who同時也是主詞，該問句並未經過倒裝，因此轉成名詞子句時詞序不變(Who left → who left)。

questions.qBody: What makes you think I don't have a boyfriend?
questions.key: I wonder what makes you think I don't have a boyfriend?
questions.notes: 原本問句的疑問詞what同時也是主詞，該問句並未經過倒裝，因此轉成名詞子句時詞序不變(What makes → what makes)。

questions.qBody: I know an eccentric computer geek. He might be able to solve your problem.
questions.hint: I know an eccentric computer geek
questions.key: I know an eccentric computer geek who might be able to solve your problem.
questions.notes: 想用「古怪的」來形容「電腦宅」時，只要在computer geek前面加上一個單詞eccentric即可；但要表達出「也許可以幫你解決問題的電腦宅」，無法單靠一個形容詞，必須在a computer geek的後面加上who might be able to solve your problem，這個部分就稱為形容詞子句。其中a computer geek是被形容的對象，文法上稱為該子句的「先行詞」；而who代表的就是a computer geek，文法上稱為關係代名詞。

questions.qBody: My sister has a fancy dress. It looks exactly like the one in the video.
questions.hint: My sister has a fancy dress
questions.key: My sister has a fancy dress which looks exactly like the one in the video.
questions.notes: 想用「花俏的」來形容「洋裝」時，就直接說a fancy dress；但「看起來和影片裡的那件一模一樣的洋裝」則無法單靠一個形容詞來表達，所以在a dress的後面加上which looks exactly ... in the video這個形容詞子句。注意：先行詞a fancy dress是「人以外的事物」，因此關係代名詞不用who而改用which。

questions.qBody: A dog is lying at the doorstep. It belongs to an old man. He is standing by the bar.
questions.hint: The dog that is lying at the doorstep
questions.key: The dog that is lying at the doorstep belongs to the old man that is standing by the bar.
questions.notes: 本例有兩個形容詞子句，原為The dog which is lying at the doorstep以及the man who is standing by the bar；無論先行詞是「人」或「事物」，關係代名詞都可以使用that代替who或which。

questions.qBody: James was happy to see Anna wearing a scarf. He bought her the scarf.
questions.hint: James was happy to see Anna wearing the scarf
questions.key: James was happy to see Anna wearing the scarf which he had bought her.
questions.notes: 關係代名詞有時候是形容詞子句的主詞，有時候則是受詞，如本例的which代表the scarf，是動詞bought的受詞。

questions.qBody: He can easily start a conversation with people even if he has never met them before.
questions.hint: He can easily start a conversation with someone
questions.key: He can easily start a conversation with someone whom he has never met before.
questions.notes: 本例的whom是關係代名詞who的受格，代表someone，是子句中動詞has met的受詞。在一般非正式的場合，多半用that或who代替whom。

questions.qBody: You recommended a doctor, and I went to see her. She prescribed some medication, but I didn't take it.
questions.hint: I went to see the doctor you recommended, but
questions.key: I went to see the doctor you recommended, but I didn't take the medication she prescribed.
questions.notes: 一般情況下，作為受詞的關係代名詞可以省略，如本例中的the doctor (that) you recommended和the medication (that) she prescribed.
